criteria: Differentiation Between Gang and Other Groups
descriptions: Student does not provide a definition of a gang.
Student provides a vague or inaccurate definition of a gang.
Student provides a basic definition of a gang but lacks key elements.
Student provides a clear definition of a gang, including most key elements.
Student provides a comprehensive definition of a gang, including all key elements and demonstrating a solid understanding.
Student provides an insightful and nuanced definition of a gang, demonstrating a deep understanding and awareness of complexities.
Student does not attempt to differentiate a gang from other groups.
Student provides inaccurate or irrelevant comparisons between a gang and other groups.
Student makes superficial comparisons, identifying few differences between a gang and other groups.
Student identifies several key differences between a gang and other groups (club, sports team, clique).
Student clearly and accurately explains the key differences between a gang and other groups, providing supporting examples.
Student provides a sophisticated analysis of the distinctions between a gang and other groups, highlighting subtle but important differences and demonstrating critical thinking.
